intro: Platystele tobarii, commonly known as the Tobar's ghost plant, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of other plants without deriving nutrients from them. The species is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and a short, inconspicuous stem. It produces a single, short-lived flower that is typically white or pale green. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Platystele tobarii is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
